page.title: 13Ecology of Salem & District
page.content: The overall climate is wet. The "snow line" runs through the top 4 squares in the area surveyed, at the level of Ffrwd (Approx. 1000ft). In Spring and Autumn the area is often above the cloud level, therefore misty rain is prevalent. The "dry-wet" line appears to run just below Cil y wern (25/63)- the contrast in the state of the road at this point is very marked. Salem Village is in a clay basin with no natural drainage except the Myddyfi stream- so the land is wet and poorly drained. The hedgerows are still mostly intact, the original small fields remaining, and so the verges and hedges are prolific in wild life and flowers. The common has some unusual plants not found elsewhere in the district. Red deer are frequently seen locally.
